title: Building a Better Bio: A Lore Dev Blog

embed.description: During the Bilgewater: Burning Tides event, you may have noticed we took the opportunity to update the bios of key champs featured in the story: Twisted Fate , Graves , Miss Fortune and Gangplank . (And if you didn't, go read 'em now - we'll wait for ya!)

body: A look in to Narrative's insights on how lore will be done in the future, particularly for bios. Take a gander!

He's like greased lightning.
LoL, they're holding up gangplank as their example of not destroying beloved champs? Thats hilarious.

I think the update was consistent with his old lore.

Are you referencing to the disconnect of his old in-game representation and his old lore?

I don't agree that there was as huge a disconnect as people say there was,
but even if there was this huge gap between game and lore, which one do you think people had more attachment to? One people were exposed to countless times and the other Riot even admits didn't engage a significant part of the playerbase.

It's a valid argument that going with the in-game representation could've been more appropriate for GP fans, I agree. 

***
Apparently Riot decided not to do it. Considering that, I think they nailed the GP from the text version.

>As he grew, the young man rapidly became the most ruthless and feared pirate in all of Bilgewater, and his daddy was never more proud than on the day of his son's eighteenth birthday - when Gangplank stabbed his old man in the back and claimed the famed pirate ship, the Dead Pool, for his own. 

This is the same character as the new Gangplank before his fall, isn't it?

I've been wanting more Targon lore for a long time, but hearing that it is actually coming makes me pretty apprehensive. There is a ton of community lore about these characters, so they will have to be really careful to not completely contradict the vision most people have of them.
What I'm worried the most about is Pantheon being a warmonger with no redeeming qualities.
Cookies!  Cupcakes!  Bread!  ALL THE BREAD!

I'm still waiting for lore that could not have existed with the League in place and was better without it. So far, the new lore has been quality, but also rather generic and doesn't stand out from other fantasy universes. Too much has been rewriting and not enough progression.
You serious? You honestly think these new Shadow Isles bio's could exist within the old universe? Also, how exactly could the physical manifestation of death be a champion in the old universe?

>Also, how exactly could the physical manifestation of death be a champion in the old universe?

By manifesting... mentally? Isn't that even easier than manifesting physically?
Yes but why would Kindred want to join the league? If anything they'd probably rather be rid of it considering how many times people cheat death in its walls through the fields of justice.

Well, people die on the rift. This means Kindred would already be there. No clue *why* they'd participate, but they were written without IoW in mind. Different settings have different limitations on characters. 

Had Kindred been in the old lore world, they would've gotten a different background to explain why.

A somewhat contrived reason (but could be good with better writing than I'm giving it) would be for Wolf to hunt prey that can fight back perhaps. 
Another would be a desire for Lamb and Wolf to desire to be together again, or to find means to fight the Shadow Isles, thus turning to a place of great knowledge for assistance. 
These are not the best reasons of course, but show there are ways for Kindred to have a desire to join.

Personally I'm not a fan of many of the new champions like Bard or Kindred as they seem to lack an ability to interact with champions that would be meaningful to the greater story. The League (I think) enabled more interesting interactions and built a more cohesive story.
